metadata.title: CVE-2019-12106 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The updateDevice function in minissdpd.c in MiniUPnP MiniSSDPd 1.4 and 1.5allows a remote attacker to crash the process due to a Use After Freevulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12106` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

minissdpd - 1.5.20190210-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: minissdpd package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.20190210-1').
